subject: Re: [junit] Test Run Directory

messageBody:
Thanks David - I'll try the maven users group next.

I have a standard where all output created by tests
should be put in src/test/output.

In some cases this is facilitated by having a root
directory File on the component, but this component
does not need it, so the component remains cleaner if
junit is just "tricked" into thinking that it started
from src/test/output...

Thanks again,
- Ole

--- David Saff <saff@...> wrote:

> Ole,
>
> Is there a maven forum that you could ask this in?
> You may luck out and

>

>
> David Saff
>
> P.S. Would it make sense right now to take a note to
> at some time
> redesign your component so that the dependency on
> the current working
> directory is well-encapsulated?
>
> ole_ersoy wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > Does anyone know whether I can specify which
> directory
> > a junit test will run in.
> >
> > Let me elaborate a little.
> >
> > I'm using Maven to run the tests, but in this case
> I want the
> > test to think that it is running in a directory
> "src/test/output"
> > relative to the directory that the tests are
> launced from.
> >
> > In other words I want the JUnit test to think it
> is being run from
> >
> > $basedir/src/test/output, when I'm really running
> it from $basedir.
> >
> > The component I'm testing creates directories, so
> my end goal is to
> > have that component create the directories
> relative to
> >
> > $basedir/src/test/output
> >
> > Thanks,
> > - Ole
